page.title: 15COTTAGE HOSPITAL
page.content: Kilsyth & District Victoria Memorial Cottage Hospital was built in 1903 for the miners and their families. After one terrible mining disaster there were so many casualties that they were lined up on stretchers outside. The first ambulance was bought from money recieved when Mrs Margaret Gentles left her entire estate(Â£580) to the hospital. Although they used to perform operations here they don't nowadays. Most of the patients in the two wards are old people suffering from cancer, arthritis or strokes. Treatment was by drugs and physiotherapy. The casualty department treats minor injuries but seriously injured people have to go to Stobhill Hospital.
